Action.Name: AddItemCampaign
Action.Description: Adds an item to a campaign.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of record to be added to the campaign. The added item must be one of the following entity types: Campaign, List, Product, or SalesLiterature.
The logical name of the type of entity that is used in the operation.The following values are valid: campaign, list, product, or salesliterature.
The ID of the campaign.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the resulting campaign item.

Action.Name: AddItemCampaignActivity
Action.Description: Adds an item to a campaign activity.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the item to be added to the campaign activity.
The logical name of the type of entity that is used in the operation.
The ID of the campaign activity

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the resulting campaign activity item.

Action.Name: AddListMembersList
Action.Description: Adds members to the list.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the list.
The IDs of the members that you want to add to the list

Action.Name: AddMemberList
Action.Description: Adds a member to a marketing list.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the member you want to add to the list.
The ID of the list.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the resulting list member.

Action.Name: AddMembersTeam
Action.Description: Adds members to a team.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the team.
The IDs for the users you want to add to the team.

Action.Name: AddPrincipalToQueue
Action.Description: Adds the specified principal to the list of queue members. If the principal is a team, add each team member to the queue.

Parameters.Parameter: The principal to add to the queue.
The ID of the queue

Action.Name: AddRecurrence
Action.Description: Adds recurrence information to an existing appointment.

Parameters.Parameter: A recurring appointment master record to which the appointment is converted.
The ID of the appointment that needs to be converted into a recurring appointment.

Action.ReturnType: The newly created recurring appointment.

Action.Name: AddToQueue
Action.Description: Moves an entity record from a source queue to a destination queue.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the source queue.
The ID of the destination queue.
The record to add to the destination queue
The properties that are needed to create a queue item in the destination queue.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the queue item that is created in the destination queue.

Action.Name: AddUserToRecordTeam
Action.Description: Adds a user to the auto created access team for the specified record.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of system user (user) to add to the auto created access team.
The ID of team template which is used to create the access team.
The record for which the access team is auto created

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the auto created access team.

Action.Name: ApplyRoutingRule
Action.Description: Applies the active routing rule to an incident.

Parameters.Parameter: The incident to apply the routing rule to.

Action.Name: AutoMapEntity
Action.Description: Generates a new set of attribute mappings based on the metadata.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the entity map to overwrite when the automated mapping is performed.

Action.Name: CalculateActualValueOpportunity
Action.Description: Calculates the value of an opportunity that is in the "Won" state.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the opportunity.

Action.ReturnType: The actual value of an opportunity.

Action.Name: CalculatePrice
Action.Description: Calculates price in an opportunity, quote, order, and invoice. This is used internally for custom pricing calculation when the default system pricing is overridden.

Parameters.Parameter: For internal use only.
For internal use only.

Remarks.p: This message does not have any usage scenario of its own. It provides you the capability to plug in your own custom pricing calculation logic if you do not want to use the out-of-box pricing provided by CRM. To use this message, you must create a plug-in with the custom pricing logic, and register the plug-in on the CalculatePrice action. Additionally, you must set the value of the Organization.OOBPriceCalculationEnabled attribute to 0 (false) to override the system pricing engine. More information: Use custom pricing for products.

Action.Name: CalculateRollupField
Action.Description: Calculate the value of a rollup attribute.

Parameters.Parameter: The logical name of the attribute to calculate.
A reference to the record containing the rollup attribute to calculate.

Action.ReturnType: The attributes relevant to the calculated rollup attribute.

Action.Name: CalculateTotalTimeIncident
Action.Description: Calculates the total time, in minutes, that you used while you worked on an incident (case).

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the incident (case).

Action.ReturnType: The total time in minutes that you use when you work on an incident (case).

Action.Name: CancelContract
Action.Description: Cancels a contract.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the contract.
The status of the contract.
The contract cancellation date.

Action.Name: CancelSalesOrder
Action.Description: Cancels a sales order (order).

Parameters.Parameter: The close activity that is associated with the sales order (order) that you want to cancel.
The status of the sales order (order).

Action.Name: CheckIncomingEmail
Action.Description: Checks whether the incoming email message is relevant to the Microsoft Dynamics CRM system.

Parameters.Parameter: The addresses of the carbon copy (Cc) recipients for the email message.
The subject line for the email message.
The addresses of the recipients of the email message.
The from address for the email message.
The ID of the email message stored in the email header.
For internal use only.
The addresses of the blind carbon copy (Bcc) recipients for the email message.

Action.ReturnType: A pair of values that indicates whether the message should be delivered to Microsoft Dynamics CRM and a reason.

Action.Name: CheckPromoteEmail
Action.Description: Checks whether the incoming email message should be promoted to the Microsoft Dynamics CRM system.

Parameters.Parameter: The message ID that is contained in the email header.
The direction of a mail checked for promotion for uniqueness.
The subject of the message.

Action.ReturnType: A pair of values that indicates whether the message should be promoted to Microsoft Dynamics CRM and a reason

Action.Name: CloneContract
Action.Description: Copies an existing contract and its line items.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the contract to be copied.
Whether the canceled line items of the originating contract are to be included in the copy (clone).

Action.ReturnType: The resulting contract.

Action.Name: CloneProduct
Action.Description: Copies an existing product family, product, or bundle under the same parent record.

Parameters.Parameter: The source product family, product, or bundle record that you want to clone.

Action.ReturnType: The cloned product record.

Action.Name: CloseIncident
Action.Description: Closes an incident (case).

Parameters.Parameter: The status of the incident.
The incident resolution (case resolution) that is associated with the incident (case) to be closed.

Action.Name: CloseQuote
Action.Description: Closes a quote.

Parameters.Parameter: The closed status of the quote
The quote to be closed.

Action.Name: CompoundUpdateDuplicateDetectionRule
Action.Description: Updates a duplicate rule (duplicate detection rule) and its related duplicate rule conditions.

Parameters.Parameter: A collection of the duplicate rule conditions that you want updated.
The duplicate rule that you want updated.

Action.Name: ConvertOwnerTeamToAccessTeam
Action.Description: Convert a team of type owner to a team of type access.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the owner team to be converted.

Action.Name: ConvertQuoteToSalesOrder
Action.Description: Converts a quote to a sales order.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the quote to convert.
The description of the quoteclose activity to generate for the closed quote.
The status of the quoteclose activity to generate for the closed quote.
The collection of attributes to retrieve in the resulting sales order (order).
The subject of the quoteclose activity to generate for the closed quote.
The date of the quoteclose activity to generate for the closed quote.

Action.ReturnType: The resulting sales order (order).

Action.Name: ConvertSalesOrderToInvoice
Action.Description: Converts a sales order to an invoice.

Parameters.Parameter: The collection of attributes to retrieve from the resulting invoice.
The ID of the sales order (order) to convert.

Action.ReturnType: The resulting invoice.

Action.Name: CopyCampaign
Action.Description: Copies a campaign.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the base campaign to copy from.
A value that indicates whether to save the campaign as a template.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the newly created campaign.

Action.Name: CopyCampaignResponse
Action.Description: Creates a copy of the campaign response.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the campaign response to copy from.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the newly created campaign response.

Action.Name: CopyDynamicListToStatic
Action.Description: Creates a static list from the specified dynamic list and add the members that satisfy the dynamic list query criteria to the static list.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the dynamic list.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the created static list.

Action.Name: CopyMembersList
Action.Description: Copies the members from the source list to the target list without creating duplicates.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the target list
The ID of the source list.

Action.Name: CreateActivitiesList
Action.Description: Creates a quick campaign to distribute an activity to members of a list (marketing list).

Parameters.Parameter: The propagation ownership options.
The ID of the queue to which the created activities are added.
The ID of the list
The activity to be distributed.
The owner for the activity.
A value that indicates whether the activity is both created and executed.
A display name for the campaign.
A value that indicates whether an asynchronous job is used to distribute an activity, such as an email, fax, or letter, to the members of a list.
A value that indicates whether to send an email about the new activity.
The ID of the email template.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the bulk operation created to distribute the campaign activity.

Action.Name: CreateException
Action.Description: Creates an exception for the recurring appointment instance.

Parameters.Parameter: The target appointment for the exception.
The original start date of the recurring appointment.
Whether the appointment instance is deleted.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the exception appointment.

Action.Name: CreateInstance
Action.Description: Creates future unexpanded instances for the recurring appointment master.

Parameters.Parameter: The appointment instance to create.
The number of instances to be created

Action.ReturnType: Whether the series can be expanded.

Action.Name: DeleteAuditData
Action.Description: Deletes all audit data records up until a specified end date.

Parameters.Parameter: The end date and time.

Action.ReturnType: The number of deleted audit partitions or the number of deleted Audit records.

Action.Name: DeleteOpenInstances
Action.Description: Deletes instances of a recurring appointment master that have an "Open" state.

Parameters.Parameter: The end date for the recurring appointment series.
The value to be used to set the status of appointment instances that have already passed
The target record for the operation.

Action.Name: DeliverIncomingEmail
Action.Description: Creates an email activity record from an incoming email message (Track in CRM).

Parameters.Parameter: The from address for the email message.
The email address of the account that is creating the email activity instance.
The addresses of the recipients of the email message.
The subject line for the email message.
The time the message was received on.
A collection of activity mime attachment (email attachment) instances to attach to the email message.
The message body for the email.
The addresses of the carbon copy (Cc) recipients for the email message.
Whether to validate before the create operation occurs.
For internal use only.
The addresses of the blind carbon copy (Bcc) recipients for the email message.
The level of importance for the email message.
The ID of the email message stored in the email header.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the email.

Action.Name: DeliverPromoteEmail
Action.Description: Creates an email activity record from the specified email message (Track in CRM).

Parameters.Parameter: The time the message was received on.
The subject line for the email message.
The level of importance for the email message.
The addresses of the carbon copy (Cc) recipients for the email message.
The ID of the email message stored in the email header.
A collection of activity mime attachment (email attachment) records to attach to the email message
The addresses of the blind carbon copy (Bcc) recipients for the email message.
The email address of the account that is creating the email activity instance.
The addresses of the recipients of the email message.
The message body for the email.
The extra properties for the email.
The ID of the email from which to create the email.
The address of the sender of the email message.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the newly created email activity.

Action.Name: DistributeCampaignActivity
Action.Description: Creates a bulk operation that distributes a campaign activity. The appropriate activities, such as a phone call or fax, are created for the members of the list that is associated with the specified campaign activity.

Parameters.Parameter: A value that indicates whether to send an email about the new activity.
The activity to be distributed.
The ID of the email template.
A value that indicates whether an asynchronous job is used to distribute activities, such as an email, fax, or letter, to the members of a list.
The ID of the queue to which the created activity is added.
A value that indicates whether the activity is both created and executed.
The owner for the newly created activity.
The ID of the campaign activity for which the activity is distributed.
The ownership options for the activity.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the bulk operation that is used to distribute the campaign activity.

Action.Name: ExpandCalendar
Action.Description: Converts the calendar rules to an array of available time blocks for the specified period.

Parameters.Parameter: The start of the period to expand.
The ID of the calendar.
The end of the time period to expand.

Action.ReturnType: A set of time blocks with appointment information.

Action.Name: ApplyRecordConversionRule
Action.Description: Applies a conversion rule to a record.

Parameters.Parameter: The record to apply the conversion rule to.

Action.Name: Book
Action.Description: Schedules or "books" an appointment, recurring appointment, or service appointment (service activity).

Parameters.Parameter: The record that is the target of the book operation
For internal use only.
For internal use only.

Action.ReturnType: The appointment validation results.

Action.Name: DeleteEntityKey
Action.Description: Deletes an entity alternate key

Parameters.Parameter: The name of the entity alternate key.
The logical name of the entity that the alternate key is part of.

Action.Name: ExportFieldTranslation
Action.Description: Exports localizable field values to a compressed file.
Action.ReturnType: The compressed file that represents the exported translation file.

Action.Name: ExportToExcelOnline
Action.Description: For internal use only.

Parameters.Parameter: For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.

Action.ReturnType: For internal use only.

Action.Name: FulfillSalesOrder
Action.Description: Fulfills the sales order (order).

Parameters.Parameter: The order close activity associated with the sales order (order) to be fulfilled.
The status of the sales order (order).

Action.Name: GenerateInvoiceFromOpportunity
Action.Description: Generates an invoice from an opportunity.

Parameters.Parameter: The collection of attributes to retrieve from the resulting invoice.
The ID of the opportunity to be used as the basis for the new invoice.

Action.ReturnType: The resulting invoice.

Action.Name: GenerateQuoteFromOpportunity
Action.Description: Generate a quote from an opportunity.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the opportunity to be used as the basis for the new quote.
The collection of attributes to retrieve in the resulting quote.

Action.ReturnType: The resulting quote.

Action.Name: GenerateSalesOrderFromOpportunity
Action.Description: Generate a sales order (order) from an opportunity.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the opportunity to be used as the basis for the new sales order (order).
The collection of attributes to retrieve from the resulting sales order (order).

Action.ReturnType: The resulting sales order (order).

Action.Name: GenerateSocialProfile
Action.Description: Returns an existing social profile record if one exists, otherwise generates a new one and returns it.

Parameters.Parameter: The social profile instance to return or generate.

Action.ReturnType: The social profile returned by the message.

Action.Name: GetDefaultPriceLevel
Action.Description: For internal use only.

Action.Name: GetTrackingTokenEmail
Action.Description: Returns a tracking token that can then be passed as a parameter to the SendEmailRequest message.

Parameters.Parameter: The context of the email.

Action.ReturnType: The requested tracking token.

Action.Name: ImportFieldTranslation
Action.Description: Import translations from a compressed file.

Parameters.Parameter: The compressed translations file.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the import job that will be created to perform this import.

Action.Name: InitializeFrom
Action.Description: Initialize a new record from an existing record.

Parameters.Parameter: The record that is the source for initializing.
The logical name of the target entity.
Which attributes are to be initialized in the initialized instance.

Action.ReturnType: The initialized instance.

Action.Name: InstallSampleData
Action.Description: Installs the sample data into the organization.

Action.Name: InstantiateFilters
Action.Description: Instantiate a set of filters for CRM for Outlook for the specified user.

Parameters.Parameter: The set of filters to instantiate for the user.
The ID of the user that will own the user query records created.

Action.Name: IsValidStateTransition
Action.Description: Validate the state transition.

Parameters.Parameter: The proposed new status for the record.
The proposed new state for the record.
The entity reference for the record whose transition state is validated.

Action.ReturnType: A value that indicates whether the state transition is valid.

Action.Name: LockInvoicePricing
Action.Description: Locks the total price of products and services that are specified in the invoice.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the invoice.

Action.Name: LockSalesOrderPricing
Action.Description: Locks the total price of products and services that are specified in the sales order (order).

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the sales order.

Action.Name: LoseOpportunity
Action.Description: Sets the state of an opportunity to Lost.

Parameters.Parameter: The opportunity close activity.
The status of the opportunity.

Action.Name: Merge
Action.Description: Merge the information from two entity records of the same type.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the entity record from which to merge data.
Additional entity attributes to be set during the merge operation for accounts, contacts, or leads. This property is not applied when merging incidents.
The target of the merge operation.
A value that indicates whether to check if the parent information is different for the two entity records.

Action.Name: PickFromQueue
Action.Description: Assign a queue item to a user and optionally remove the queue item from the queue.

Parameters.Parameter: Whether the queue item should be removed from the queue.
The ID of the queue item.
The user to assign the queue item to.

Action.Name: ProcessInboundEmail
Action.Description: Process the email responses from a marketing campaign.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the inbound email activity.

Action.Name: PublishProductHierarchy
Action.Description: Publish a product family record and all its child records.

Parameters.Parameter: The target product family record that you want to publish along with its child records.

Action.Name: QualifyLead
Action.Description: Qualify a lead and create account, contact, and opportunity records that are linked to the originating lead record.

Parameters.Parameter: The currency to use for this opportunity.
A value that indicates whether to create an account from the originating lead.
The ID of the lead that is qualified.
The status of the lead.
Whether to qualify the lead if duplicate records are found.
A value that indicates whether to create an opportunity from the originating lead.
A value that indicates whether to create an account from the originating lead.
The source campaign that is associated with the opportunity.
The account or contact that is associated with the opportunity.

Action.ReturnType: The collection of references to the newly created account, contact, and opportunity records.

Action.Name: QualifyMemberList
Action.Description: Qualify the specified list and either override the list members or remove them according to the specified option.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the list to qualify.
An array of IDs of the members to qualify.
A value that indicates whether to override or remove the members from the list.

Action.Name: QueryMultipleSchedules
Action.Description: Search multiple resources for available time block that match the specified parameters.

Parameters.Parameter: The start of the time slot.
The time codes to look for: Available, Busy, Unavailable, or Filter, which correspond to the resource IDs.
The IDs of the resources.
The end time for the scheduled block of time.

Action.ReturnType: The results of the search, which is a set of possible time block for each resource.

Action.Name: QuerySchedule
Action.Description: Search the specified resource for an available time block that matches the specified parameters.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the resource.
The time codes to look for: Available, Busy, Unavailable, or Filter.
The start of the time slot.
The end of the time slot.

Action.ReturnType: The results of the search, a set of possible time slots for the resource.

Action.Name: ReactivateEntityKey
Action.Description: Submits a new asynchronous system job to create the index for the key.

Parameters.Parameter: The key name.
The entity logical name.

Action.Name: ReassignObjectsOwner
Action.Description: Reassign all records that are owned by the security principal (user or team) to another security principal (user or team).

Parameters.Parameter: The security principal (user or team) for which to reassign all records.
The security principal (user or team) that will be the new owner for the records.

Action.Name: ReassignObjectsSystemUser
Action.Description: Reassign all records that are owned by a specified user to another security principal (user or team).

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the user for which you want to reassign all records.
The security principal (user or team) that is the new owner for the records.

Action.Name: Recalculate
Action.Description: Recalculate system-computed values for rollup fields in the goal hierarchy.

Parameters.Parameter: The target record for the recalculate operation.

Action.Name: ReleaseToQueue
Action.Description: Assign a queue item back to the queue owner so others can pick it.

Parameters.Parameter: The id of the queue item.

Action.Name: RemoveFromQueue
Action.Description: Remove a queue item from a queue.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the queue item to remove from the queue.

Action.Remarks: The QueueItemId property corresponds to the QueueItem.QueueItemId attribute, which is the primary key for the QueueItem entity.

Action.Name: RemoveItemCampaign
Action.Description: Removes an item from a campaign.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the item to be removed from the campaign.
The ID of the campaign.

Action.Name: RemoveItemCampaignActivity
Action.Description: Remove an item from a campaign activity.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the item to be removed from the campaign activity.
The ID of the campaign activity.

Action.Name: RemoveMemberList
Action.Description: Remove a member from a list (marketing list).

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the member to be removed from the list.
The ID of the list.

Action.Name: RemoveMembersTeam
Action.Description: Remove members from a team.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the team.
An array of IDs of the users to be removed from the team.

Action.Name: RemoveParent
Action.Description: Remove the parent for a system user (user) record.

Parameters.Parameter: Remove the parent for a system user (user) record.

Action.Name: RemoveProductFromKit
Action.Description: Remove a product from a kit.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the kit from which the product is to be removed.
The ID of the product being removed from the kit.

Action.Remarks: Deprecated. Use the ProductAssociation entity instead.

Action.Name: RemoveRelated
Action.Description: Remove the relationship between the specified records for specific relationships.

Parameters.Parameter: The target records from which you want to remove specific related records.

Action.Name: RemoveUserFromRecordTeam
Action.Description: Remove a user from the auto created access team for the specified record.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of system user (user) to remove from the auto created access team.
The ID of team template which is used to create the access team.
The record for which the access team is auto created.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the auto created access team.

Action.Name: RenewContract
Action.Description: Renew a contract and create the contract details for a new contract.

Parameters.Parameter: A value that indicates whether the canceled line items of the original contract should be included in the renewed contract.
The status of the contract.
The ID of the contract to be renewed.

Action.ReturnType: The resulting contract.

Action.Name: RenewEntitlement
Action.Description: Renews an entitlement.

Parameters.Parameter: The id of the entitlement to renew.
The StatusCode value for the renewed Entitlement.

Action.ReturnType: The renewed entitlement.

Action.Name: Reschedule
Action.Description: Reschedule an appointment, recurring appointment, or service appointment (service activity).

Parameters.Parameter: For internal use only.
The target of the reschedule operation.
For internal use only.

Action.ReturnType: The validation results for the appointment, recurring appointment master, or service appointment (service activity).

Action.Name: ResetUserFilters
Action.Description: Resets the offline data filters for the calling user to the default filters for the organization.

Parameters.Parameter: The type of filters to set.

Action.Name: RetrieveCurrentOrganization
Action.Description: Retrieves information about the current organization.

Parameters.Parameter: The access type of the organization’s service endpoint.

Action.ReturnType: Detailed information about the current organization.
Action.Remarks: While the organization details are available from the discovery service, this message request enables you to get that same information from the organization service that your application is already connected to.

Action.Name: RetrievePrincipalSyncAttributeMappings
Action.Description: This message doesn’t have any extensibility scenarios in this release.

Action.Name: RevertProduct
Action.Description: Revert changes done to properties of a product family, product, or bundle record, and set it back to its last published (active) state.

Parameters.Parameter: The target product family, product, or bundle record for which you want to revert the changes done to its properties since it was last published.

Action.Name: ReviseQuote
Action.Description: Sets the state of a quote to Draft.

Parameters.Parameter: The collection of attributes to retrieve in the revised quote.
The ID of the original quote.

Action.ReturnType: The revised quote.

Action.Name: RevokeAccess
Action.Description: Replace the access rights on the target record for the specified security principal (user or team).

Parameters.Parameter: The target record for which you want to revoke access.
A security principal (team or user) whose access you want to revoke.

Action.Remarks: This action also applies to all child records of the target record. However for all child records, access rights are only modified if the caller has share privileges for those entity types and share access rights to the records. As a result, the owner of the target record, or a user who shares the target record, automatically has share rights to all child records of the target record.

Action.Name: RouteTo
Action.Description: Routes a queue item to a queue, a user, or a team.

Parameters.Parameter: The target record to route the queue item to.
The ID of the queue item to route.

Action.Name: Search
Action.Description: Search for available time slots that fulfill the specified appointment request.

Parameters.Parameter: The appointment request.

Action.ReturnType: The results of the search.

Action.Name: SendEmail
Action.Description: Sends an email message.

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the email to send.
Whether to send the email, or to just record it as sent.
The tracking token.

Action.ReturnType: The subject line for the email message.

Action.Name: SendEmailFromTemplate
Action.Description: Send an email message using a template.

Parameters.Parameter: The type of the record with which the email message is associated.
The ID of the record with which the email message is associated.
The email record to send.
The ID of the email template to use for the email.

Action.ReturnType: The ID of the email record that was sent.

Action.Name: SendFax
Action.Description: Sends a fax.

Parameters.Parameter: Whether to send the email, or to just record it as sent.
The ID of the fax to send.

Action.Name: SetBusinessSystemUser
Action.Description: Move a system user (user) to a different business unit.

Parameters.Parameter: The target security principal (user) to which the instances of entities previously owned by the user are to be assigned.
The ID of the user.
The ID of the business unit to which the user is moved.

Action.Remarks: The instances of the entities that had been assigned to the user specified by the UserId property will be assigned to that security principal (user). If any of the direct reports of the user are no longer in the new business unit hierarchy after the user is moved, these direct reports are updated to report to the previous manager of the user. If the user has been moved out of his or her manager's business-unit hierarchy, the manager of the user is set to null. You may list the same user for both the UserId and ReassignPrincipal properties if you would like the user to retain the entities assigned.

Action.Name: SetParentSystemUser
Action.Description: Set a new parent system user (user) for the specified user.

Parameters.Parameter: Indicates whether the child users are to be retained.
The ID of the new parent user.
The ID of the user.

Action.Name: UninstallSampleData
Action.Description: Removes the sample data from a CRM instance.

Action.Description: Unlocks pricing for an invoice.

Action.Name: UnlockSalesOrderPricing
Action.Description: Unlocks pricing for a sales order (order).

Parameters.Parameter: The ID of the sales order (order).

Action.Description: Deprecated. Use the Update action.

Deprecated. Use the Update action.
